definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

sentences.english: But because of a current glut in the market, the average rate of depreciation has nearly doubled.
sentences.chinese: 但是按照現在的市場行情，平均折舊率是以前的兩倍。

sentences.english: The solution is to cancel the account of the consumable goods of low value and to count the comprehensive rate of depreciation.
sentences.chinese: 解決的方法是取消低值易耗品帳戶，計算綜合折舊率。

sentences.english: The allowance for depreciation of all sorts of different fixed assets is different.
sentences.chinese: 各種不同的固定資產的折舊率是不一樣的。
